pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:5.1: 23. The training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with their upper robes covering their heads. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:7.2: “‘I will not walk with my head covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not cover the head.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with his upper robe covering his head, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
